snippet: If the former Fox News anchor’s suit is forced into arbitration, her chances of winning are lessened, and little will be made public about it....
abstract: Legal experts say chances of former Fox News anchor Gretchen Carlson prevailing in her sexual harassment suit against Roger Ailes will diminish significantly if case is moved to arbitration; clause in Carlson's contract with news organization makes arbitration process even more secretive than it usually is; arbitration clauses have proliferated over last decade as corporations have sought to keep employment disputes private.

byline.original: By NOAM SCHEIBER and JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG

lead_paragraph: If the former Fox News anchor’s suit is forced into arbitration, her chances of winning are lessened, and little will be made public about it.

headline.main: Gretchen Carlson’s Fox News Contract Could Shroud Her Case in Secrecy
headline.print_headline: Ousted Anchor’s Fox Contract Could Shroud Her Case in Secrecy
